{"step_by_step_thinking": "Haemophilia is a genetic disorder that affects the blood's ability to clot. The management of haemophilic patients typically involves replacing the missing clotting factor. Tranexamic acid is a medication that helps to prevent or reduce bleeding by inhibiting the breakdown of blood clots. Acetic acid is not used in the management of haemophilic patients. Ascorbic acid, also known as vitamin C, does not play a direct role in the management of haemophilia. Palmitonic acid is not used in the management of haemophilic patients either.", "answer_choice": "A"}
